20110112020024.000|20110112020024.000|CC1|WE BEGIN TONIGHT WITH A         
20110112020024.000|20110112020026.000|CC1|QUESTION.                       
20110112020026.000|20110112020028.000|CC1|WHAT IF YOU HAD A GUN THAT WAS  
20110112020028.000|20110112020030.000|CC1|ENTIRELY MADE OF PLASTIC?       
20110112020030.000|20110112020032.000|CC1|WHERE ALL THE COMPONENTS OF THE 
20110112020032.000|20110112020034.000|CC1|GUN WERE HIGH STRENGTH ENOUGH SO
20110112020034.000|20110112020036.000|CC1|THE GUN WOULD FUNCTION AS A GUN,
20110112020036.000|20110112020038.000|CC1|BUT NONE OF IT WAS METAL, SO IT 
20110112020038.000|20110112020041.000|CC1|WOULDN'T BE DETECTED BY METAL   
20110112020041.000|20110112020041.000|CC1|DETECTORS.                      
20110112020041.000|20110112020043.000|CC1|THAT MEANS THAT EVERYONE THAT IS
20110112020043.000|20110112020045.000|CC1|PROTECTED BY METAL DETECTORS    
20110112020045.000|20110112020046.000|CC1|FROM THE CAPITOL BUILD TO AN    
20110112020046.000|20110112020047.000|CC1|AIRPORT TO AN EVENT TO SEE THE  
20110112020047.000|20110112020048.000|CC1|PRESIDENT, YOU'D BE ABLE TO GET 
20110112020048.000|20110112020051.000|CC1|YOUR GUN IN THERE, SCOT-FREE.   
20110112020051.000|20110112020052.000|CC1|YOU COULD WALK RIGHT THROUGH A  
20110112020052.000|20110112020054.000|CC1|METAL DETECTOR WITH YOUR GUN AND
20110112020054.000|20110112020055.000|CC1|NOBODY WOULD KNOW YOU HAD THAT  
20110112020055.000|20110112020055.000|CC1|GUN.                            
20110112020055.000|20110112020058.000|CC1|SHOULD IT BE LEGAL TO CARRY AN  
20110112020058.000|20110112020058.000|CC1|ALL-PLASTIC GUN?                
20110112020058.000|20110112020100.000|CC1|THESE THINGS CAN BE             
20110112020100.000|20110112020101.000|CC1|MANUFACTURED.                   
20110112020101.000|20110112020102.000|CC1|GLOCK, THE COMPANY THAT MADE THE
20110112020102.000|20110112020103.000|CC1|GUN THAT WAS USED IN THE ARIZONA
20110112020103.000|20110112020105.000|CC1|SHOOTING THIS WEEKEND, GLOCK    
20110112020105.000|20110112020107.000|CC1|ANNOUNCED BACK IN THE 1980s THAT
20110112020107.000|20110112020108.000|CC1|THEY HAD PERFECTED MANUFACTURING
20110112020108.000|20110112020110.000|CC1|TECHNIQUES THAT WOULD ALLOW THEM
20110112020110.000|20110112020110.000|CC1|TO DO THIS.                     
20110112020110.000|20110112020114.000|CC1|SHOULD AN UNDETECTABLE GUN LIKE 
20110112020114.000|20110112020115.000|CC1|THAT BE LEGAL TO BUY IN THE     
20110112020115.000|20110112020118.000|CC1|UNITED STATES?                  
20110112020118.000|20110112020118.000|CC1|NO.                             
20110112020118.000|20110112020120.000|CC1|THAT SHOULD NOT BE LEGAL.       
20110112020120.000|20110112020122.000|CC1|AT LEAST, THAT WAS THE DECISION 
20110112020122.000|20110112020123.000|CC1|THAT OUR COUNTRY MADE WHEN THE  
20110112020123.000|20110112020124.000|CC1|ISSUE CAME UP.                  
20110112020124.000|20110112020126.000|CC1|CONGRESS VOTED ON WHETHER       
20110112020126.000|20110112020127.000|CC1|PLASTIC GUNS SHOULD BE LEGAL TO 
20110112020127.000|20110112020130.000|CC1|SELL IN THIS COUNTRY BACK IN    
20110112020130.000|20110112020130.000|CC1|1988.                           
20110112020130.000|20110112020132.000|CC1|THE MEASURE PASSED THE HOUSE BY 
20110112020132.000|20110112020135.000|CC1|A VOTE OF 413 TO 4.             
20110112020135.000|20110112020137.000|CC1|THERE WERE ONLY FOUR VOTES      
20110112020137.000|20110112020137.000|CC1|AGAINST IT.                     
20110112020137.000|20110112020140.000|CC1|ONE OF THOSE FOUR VOTES, ONE OF 
20110112020140.000|20110112020142.000|CC1|THE TOTAL OF FOUR PEOPLE WHO    
20110112020142.000|20110112020143.000|CC1|VOTED AGAINST MAKING PLASTIC    
20110112020143.000|20110112020147.000|CC1|GUNS ILLEGAL AT THE TIME WAS    
20110112020147.000|20110112020148.000|CC1|THEN-CONGRESSMAN DICK CHENEY OF 
20110112020148.000|20110112020149.000|CC1|WYOMING.                        
20110112020149.000|20110112020151.000|CC1|12 YEARS AFTER THAT VOTE, 12    
20110112020151.000|20110112020154.000|CC1|YEARS LATER, IN THE YEAR 2000,  
20110112020154.000|20110112020155.000|CC1|DICK CHENEY WAS STILL CATCHING  
20110112020155.000|20110112020156.000|CC1|HELL FOR THAT VOTE.             
20110112020156.000|20110112020159.000|CC1|THAT VOTE HAUNTED HIM HIS ENTIRE
20110112020159.000|20110112020202.000|CC1|POLITICAL CAREER.               
20110112020202.000|20110112020204.000|CC1|>> TWO VOTES THAT REALLY DID    
20110112020204.000|20110112020206.000|CC1|CREATE A LOT OF INTEREST,       
20110112020206.000|20110112020208.000|CC1|PARTICULARLY AMONGST POLICE     
20110112020208.000|20110112020209.000|CC1|ORGANIZATIONS, WERE YOUR VOTES  
20110112020209.000|20110112020209.000|CC1|ON GUN CONTROL.                 
20110112020209.000|20110112020211.000|CC1|THE FIRST WAS A BAN ON          
20110112020211.000|20110112020212.000|CC1|COP-KILLER VOTES.               
20110112020212.000|20110112020214.000|CC1|THE VOTE WAS 400 YES, 21 NO.    
20110112020214.000|20110112020217.000|CC1|AND A VOTE ON PLASTIC GUNS THAT 
20110112020217.000|20110112020218.000|CC1|TERRORISTS USE TO HIJACK PLANES 
20110112020218.000|20110112020222.000|CC1|TO GET THEM UNDETECTABLE THROUGH
20110112020222.000|20110112020222.000|CC1|SECURITY, 413 TO 4.

20110112020225.000|20110112020226.000|CC1|NUMBERS, LIBERAL/CONSERVATIVES. 
20110112020226.000|20110112020228.000|CC1|THAT'S A FRINGE VOTE.           
20110112020228.000|20110112020230.000|CC1|YOU'RE ONE OF FOUR.

20110112020232.000|20110112020234.000|CC1|MEASURES TO BAN COP KILLER      
20110112020234.000|20110112020235.000|CC1|BULLETS AND TO BAN PLASTIC GUNS 
20110112020235.000|20110112020237.000|CC1|THAT CANNOT BE DETECTED BY

20110112020239.000|20110112020240.000|CC1|TO ENTERTAIN THAT NOTION.       
20110112020240.000|20110112020242.000|CC1|I DON'T WANT TO SAY THAT I'M    
20110112020242.000|20110112020243.000|CC1|ABSOLUTELY FOR COP KILLER       
20110112020243.000|20110112020244.000|CC1|BULLETS.

20110112020247.000|20110112020249.000|CC1|THESE MEASURES CAME UP UNDER

20110112020254.000|20110112020254.000|CC1|LIMITED.

20110112020256.000|20110112020258.000|CC1|HIM PHYSICALLY SQUIRMING ON THAT
20110112020258.000|20110112020259.000|CC1|ONE.

20110112020304.000|20110112020305.000|CC1|ABOUT THE PROCESS BY WHICH THE  
20110112020305.000|20110112020307.000|CC1|BAN WAS BROUGHT UP.

20110112020307.000|20110112020311.000|CC1|RULE PROCESS.

20110112020314.000|20110112020316.000|CC1|WAS INITIALLY OPPOSED BY THE

20110112020330.000|20110112020333.000|CC1|IT INTO LAW IN NOVEMBER OF 1988.
20110112020333.000|20110112020335.000|CC1|NOW, IN THAT "MEET THE PRESS"   
20110112020335.000|20110112020336.000|CC1|CLIP, YOU ALSO HEARD MR. RUSSERT

20110112020347.000|20110112020349.000|CC1|THIS WEEKEND'S SHOOTINGS, IF

20110112020457.000|20110112020459.000|CC1|KIND OF THING THAT, YES, IS ALSO
20110112020459.000|20110112020500.000|CC1|REGULATED BY THE FEDERAL

20110112020504.000|20110112020505.000|CC1|NOT EXTEND TO ALLOWING YOU THE  
20110112020505.000|20110112020508.000|CC1|CAPACITY AS A U.S. CITIZEN TO   
20110112020508.000|20110112020509.000|CC1|POSSESS ARTILLERY CAPABLE OF

20110112020512.000|20110112020512.000|CC1|SKY.                            
20110112020512.000|20110112020513.000|CC1|AND IT'S NOT VERY CONTROVERSIAL 
20110112020513.000|20110112020517.000|CC1|THAT THAT'S THE CASE.

20110112020519.000|20110112020521.000|CC1|MACHINE GUN OR THE PLASTIC GUNS,
20110112020521.000|20110112020523.000|CC1|THE COP KILLER BULLETS, NONE OF 
20110112020523.000|20110112020524.000|CC1|THESE THINGS ARE THE TYPE OF    
20110112020524.000|20110112020526.000|CC1|WEAPONS OR AMMUNITION THAT WERE 
20110112020526.000|20110112020527.000|CC1|USED IN THE SHOOTINGS THIS

20110112020529.000|20110112020532.000|CC1|THAT ALLEGED KILLER'S CHOICE OF 
20110112020532.000|20110112020533.000|CC1|A $500 PISTOL.                  
20110112020533.000|20110112020535.000|CC1|BUT THE IDEA THAT IN THE WAKE OF
20110112020535.000|20110112020537.000|CC1|THIS SHOOTING, IN THE WAKE OF   
20110112020537.000|20110112020539.000|CC1|THIS NATIONAL CONVULSION OF     
20110112020539.000|20110112020541.000|CC1|GRIEF AND ANGER AND A DESIRE TO 
20110112020541.000|20110112020543.000|CC1|RESPOND TO THIS SHOOTING, THE   
20110112020543.000|20110112020544.000|CC1|BELIEF THAT DESPITE HOW THE     
20110112020544.000|20110112020547.000|CC1|COUNTRY FEELS RIGHT NOW, THAT

20110112020550.000|20110112020552.000|CC1|CURTAIL GUN MASSACRE IN AMERICA 
20110112020552.000|20110112020553.000|CC1|IS IMPOSSIBLE, THE IDEA THAT    
20110112020553.000|20110112020555.000|CC1|IT'S IMPOSSIBLE TO PASS ANY     
20110112020555.000|20110112020600.000|CC1|LEGISLATION REGARDING GUNS IN   
20110112020600.000|20110112020602.000|CC1|AMERICA, I BELIEVE THAT IDEA IS 
20110112020602.000|20110112020603.000|CC1|NOT TRUE.                       
20110112020603.000|20110112020604.000|CC1|THREE DAYS OUT FROM THIS        
20110112020604.000|20110112020605.000|CC1|WEEKEND'S SHOOTING, WE ARE

20110112020607.000|20110112020608.000|CC1|WHERE NOBODY IN POLITICS CAN

20110112020611.000|20110112020612.000|CC1|DIAGNOSIS OF WHETHER OR NOT WE  
20110112020612.000|20110112020614.000|CC1|AS A COUNTRY ARE CAPABLE OF

20110112020617.000|20110112020618.000|CC1|AGREES THAT THAT'S TOTALLY      
20110112020618.000|20110112020619.000|CC1|IMPOSSIBLE, RIGHT?              
20110112020619.000|20110112020620.000|CC1|LOOK AT THIS.                   
20110112020620.000|20110112020622.000|CC1|WHY GUN CONTROL IS DEAD IN      
20110112020622.000|20110112020624.000|CC1|AMERICA.

20110112020627.000|20110112020629.000|CC1|CONTROL IS A NON-STARTER IN

20110112020642.000|20110112020645.000|CC1|FIRE DOG LAKE TODAY.

20110112020649.000|20110112020651.000|CC1|GIFFORDS' SHOOTING."            
20110112020651.000|20110112020652.000|CC1|I WAS NOT TRYING TO FIND STORIES
20110112020652.000|20110112020653.000|CC1|IN RESPONSE TO THIS SHOOTING,   
20110112020653.000|20110112020653.000|CC1|BUT THIS IS ALL THAT IS OUT

20110112023727.000|20110112023729.000|CC1|BREWER WAS FOUND NOT GUILTY BY

20110112023733.000|20110112023735.000|CC1|THE ARIZONA STATE HOSPITAL,     
20110112023735.000|20110112023736.000|CC1|WHERE HE HAS SPENT MOST OF THE  
20110112023736.000|20110112023737.000|CC1|PAST 20 YEARS.                  
20110112023737.000|20110112023738.000|CC1|JAN BREWER, HERSELF, IS         
20110112023738.000|20110112023739.000|CC1|NATIONALLY FAMOUS FOR A LOT OF  
20110112023739.000|20110112023741.000|CC1|OTHER REASONS NOW, INCLUDING THE
20110112023741.000|20110112023743.000|CC1|STATE'S ANTI-IMMIGRATION LAW SHE

20110112023746.000|20110112023748.000|CC1|SERVANT, JAN BREWER WAS A REAL  
20110112023748.000|20110112023748.000|CC1|CHAMPION OF MENTAL HEALTH       
20110112023748.000|20110112023750.000|CC1|SERVICES IN THE STATE OF        
20110112023750.000|20110112023751.000|CC1|ARIZONA.                        
20110112023751.000|20110112023751.000|CC1|AS A STATE LEGISLATOR, SHE      
20110112023751.000|20110112023753.000|CC1|PUSHED FOR MONEY IN THE STATE   
20110112023753.000|20110112023757.000|CC1|HOSPITAL'S BUDGET TO COVER A NEW
20110112023757.000|20110112023757.000|CC1|SCHIZOPHRENIA DRUG.             
20110112023757.000|20110112023758.000|CC1|AS SECRETARY OF STATE, SHE      
20110112023758.000|20110112023759.000|CC1|PUSHED FOR AN ONLINE MEDICAL    
20110112023759.000|20110112023800.000|CC1|DIRECTORY SYSTEM THAT MADE IT   
20110112023800.000|20110112023802.000|CC1|EASIER FOR ARIZONIANS TO TURN

20110112023803.000|20110112023804.000|CC1|RELATIVES FOR BOTH PHYSICAL AND

20110112023809.000|20110112023810.000|CC1|ALMOST $9 MILLION THAT HAD BEEN

20110112023900.000|20110112023901.000|CC1|OF HIM, EITHER AS A CRIMINAL

20110112023904.000|20110112023905.000|CC1|BUT THE REPORTING IS DEEP AND   
20110112023905.000|20110112023908.000|CC1|WIDE, DESCRIBING WHAT SEEMS LIKE
20110112023908.000|20110112023909.000|CC1|IRRATIONAL WRITINGS AND BELIEFS 
20110112023909.000|20110112023911.000|CC1|AND BEHAVIOR BY MR. LOUGHNER.   
20110112023911.000|20110112023912.000|CC1|THERE ARE NUMEROUS REPORTS BY   
20110112023912.000|20110112023913.000|CC1|PEOPLE WHO INTERACTED WITH HIM  
20110112023913.000|20110112023914.000|CC1|IN PERSON, AND WHO HAD THE      
20110112023914.000|20110112023915.000|CC1|FEELING THAT HE WAS MENTALLY    
20110112023915.000|20110112023917.000|CC1|ILL.                            
20110112023917.000|20110112023919.000|CC1|EVEN THOUGH BEHAVIOR THAT SEEMED
20110112023919.000|20110112023920.000|CC1|CRAZY REPORTEDLY COST MR.       
20110112023920.000|20110112023922.000|CC1|LOUGHNER HIS JOB AT A FAST FOOD 
20110112023922.000|20110112023923.000|CC1|RESTAURANT, HIS VOLUNTEER       
20110112023923.000|20110112023924.000|CC1|POSITION AT AN ANIMAL SHELTER,  
20110112023924.000|20110112023926.000|CC1|AND HIS PLACE AT A COMMUNITY    
20110112023926.000|20110112023927.000|CC1|COLLEGE, ALL RECENTLY, THERE IS 
20110112023927.000|20110112023929.000|CC1|NO EVIDENCE YET THAT HE RECEIVED
20110112023929.000|20110112023931.000|CC1|ANY MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT OR  
20110112023931.000|20110112023932.000|CC1|THAT ANYBODY FORMALLY REFERRED

20110112023933.000|20110112023936.000|CC1|LET ALONE COMMITTED HIM TO THEM

20110112024025.000|20110112024027.000|CC1|OF THE PROVISIONS OF HEALTH     
20110112024027.000|20110112024028.000|CC1|REFORM IS ALL ABOUT MAKING

20110112024029.000|20110112024030.000|CC1|INSURANCE COMPANIES HAVE TO

20110112024038.000|20110112024038.000|CC1|MIND.

20110112024040.000|20110112024041.000|CC1|HEALTH PARODY.                  
20110112024041.000|20110112024042.000|CC1|IT WAS PURSUED IN LEGISLATION   
20110112024042.000|20110112024044.000|CC1|THAT WAS CHAMPIONED BY TIPPER   
20110112024044.000|20110112024045.000|CC1|GORE IN 1996.                   
20110112024045.000|20110112024046.000|CC1|IT WAS GREATLY STRENGTHENED IN  
20110112024046.000|20110112024047.000|CC1|2008 IN A MEASURE SIGNED BY     
20110112024047.000|20110112024049.000|CC1|PRESIDENT GEORGE W. BUSH.

20110112024057.000|20110112024059.000|CC1|HEALTH REFORM MADE MENTAL HEALTH
20110112024059.000|20110112024059.000|CC1|PARODY LAW OF THE LAND.
